subject: Transplants
Medicine and Health
Football
lead_paragraph: Jerry Richardson, the Carolina Panthers owner, cleared another hurdle in his recovery from a heart transplant when he was released from the hospital 12 days after the surgery. Richardson left Carolinas Medical Center in Charlotte and was resting at home after doctors determined his body was accepting the new heart. The full recovery period takes up to six months. Richardson, 72, a former teammate of Johnny Unitas’s with the Baltimore Colts and the first former N.F.L. player since George Halas to own a team, has a history of heart trouble. He underwent quadruple bypass surgery in 2002 and last year had a pacemaker installed.
